question1.exampleOfAwesome: Releasing is simple, safe, painless & mostly automated.
question1.exampleOfCrappy:: Releasing is risky, painful, lots of manual work, and takes forever.

question2.exampleOfAwesome: Our way of working fits us perfectly.

question3.exampleOfAwesome: We’re proud of the quality of our code! It is clean, easy to read, and has great test coverage.
question3.exampleOfCrappy:: Our code is a pile of dung, and technical debt is raging out of control.

question4.exampleOfAwesome: We deliver great stuff! We're proud of it and our stakeholders are really happy.
question4.exampleOfCrappy:: We deliver crap. We feel ashamed to deliver it. Our stakeholders hate us.

question5.exampleOfAwesome: We get stuff done really quickly.No waiting, no delays.
question5.exampleOfCrappy:: We never seem to get done with anything.We keep getting stuck or interrupted. Stories keep getting stuck on dependencies.

question6.exampleOfAwesome: We know exactly why we are here, and we are really excited about it.
question6.exampleOfCrappy:: We have no idea why we are here, there is no high level picture or focus. Our so-called mission is completely unclear and uninspiring.

question7.exampleOfAwesome: We love going to work, and have great fun working together.

question8.exampleOfAwesome: We’re learning lots of interesting stuff all the time!
question8.exampleOfCrappy:: We never have time to learn anything.

question9.exampleOfAwesome: We always get great support & help when we ask for it!
question9.exampleOfCrappy:: We keep getting stuck because we can’t get the support & help that we ask for.

question10.exampleOfAwesome: We are in control of our destiny! We decide what to build and how to build it.
question10.exampleOfCrappy:: We are just pawns in a game of chess, with no influence over what we build or how we build it.

question1.exampleOfAwesome: I feel safe to be myself and to share my thoughts. We don't hesitate to engage in constructive conflicts.
question1.exampleOfCrappy:: Mistakes and failures arn't accepted. I don't feel safe to speak up in meetings. We avoid conflicts.

question2.exampleOfAwesome: I can depend on my team members. We follow through on commitments, and we hold each other accountable for our actions.
question2.exampleOfCrappy:: I don't trust my team members to do what they say they will do, or live up to things we've agreed upon.

question3.exampleOfAwesome: I understand how our team contributes to the organisation, and our mission inspires me.
question3.exampleOfCrappy:: Our team's purpose is vague or unclear. We have no long-term focus.

question4.exampleOfAwesome: I'm proud of the value we deliver to our users and stakeholders. We measure our impact, and learn from it.
question4.exampleOfCrappy:: I feel ashamed of the crap we deliver. Our stakeholders hate us.

question5.exampleOfAwesome: I feel we influence and shape our plans and destiny. We decide together how we want to work.
question5.exampleOfCrappy:: Someone else is always calling the shots. It's unclear to me what we are allowed to decide, and what we're not.

question6.exampleOfAwesome: I feel we often collaborate closely with each other toward common goals.
question6.exampleOfCrappy:: We work individually, and care little about what the others are doing.

question7.exampleOfAwesome: We passionately strive to figure out how to work better and more efficiently as a team. We try to “know” if we get better.
question7.exampleOfCrappy:: We don’t focus on questioning our process or way of working. If someone asked us to prove that we’ve gotten better we have no clue how we would demonstrate that.

question8.exampleOfAwesome: I feel we are good at making decisions as a team. When stuck we de-scope the decision, or designs them as experiments.
question8.exampleOfCrappy:: We constantly get stuck in analysis paralysis. The few decisions we make are vague.

question9.exampleOfAwesome: I feel we have time to think ahead, and room to experiment and explore.
question9.exampleOfCrappy:: I feel stressed and overworked. We only focus on here and now.

question10.exampleOfAwesome: We give positive appraisals, but also provide constructive feedback on each other's unproductive behaviours.
question10.exampleOfCrappy:: We rarely praise each other, or give feedback to each other for acting irresponsibly or breaking our Working Agreement.

question11.exampleOfAwesome: We honor our working agreements even when we are put under pressure.
question11.exampleOfCrappy:: Our behaviors, collaboration and communication fall apart when we get stressed.

question1.exampleOfAwesome: The teams trust that we are doing our best to help and support them, and that non-inclusive decisions are made with good intent.
question1.exampleOfCrappy:: We are unaware of problems and opportunities because people don't trust us enough to talk to us about them. Decisions are perceived as top-down.

question2.exampleOfAwesome: I feel safe to be myself and to share my thoughts in this team. I don't feel I need to pretend to be someone I'm not.
question2.exampleOfCrappy:: I don't feel safe to speak up in meetings. Mistakes and failures aren't accepted. I feel nervous on how I should behave.

question3.exampleOfAwesome: I can depend on my team members. We follow through on commitments, and we hold each other accountable for our actions.
question3.exampleOfCrappy:: I don't trust my team members to do what they say they will do, or live up to things we've agreed upon.

question4.exampleOfAwesome: I have room to think, and energy to deal with stressful situations.
question4.exampleOfCrappy:: I feel stressed and can't think straight. My work is mainly reactive.

question5.exampleOfAwesome: I observe that we are honest, direct and respectful in our communication. We turn conflicts into healthy constructive dialogue.
question5.exampleOfCrappy:: We shy away from conflicts. Unresolved tensions has resulted in silence and grudges.

question6.exampleOfAwesome: It's clear to me how decisions are made and who makes them. We have the courage to make decisions fast, when needed.
question6.exampleOfCrappy:: Our way of making decisions is slow and we often get stuck in debates. It's unclear to me how decisions are made or who makes them.

question7.exampleOfAwesome: We have a strong narrative that tells us where we want to be in the future. We have clear metrics that guide us when prioritising.
question7.exampleOfCrappy:: We have very different (and sometimes competing) ideas on where we want to go. Each team runs their own show, striving towards different goals.

question8.exampleOfAwesome: I see that my peers are role modeling the behaviours and values we want to live by.
question8.exampleOfCrappy:: We don't walk the talk. We send conflicting messages about our culture through our behaviors.

question9.exampleOfAwesome: We provide structure and support to the teams within which they can self-organize efficiently. We understand team dynamics and alter our leadership depending on the needs of the teams.
question9.exampleOfCrappy:: We don't provide close active leadership, nor convey clear expectations on desired behaviours. We don't trust the teams to make good decisions so we often intervene and engage in the details.

question10.exampleOfAwesome: I believe we are transparent on decisions, plans and our intents. We communicate information and news in a timely fashion.
question10.exampleOfCrappy:: We are an information bottleneck. We don't share victories and failures.

question11.exampleOfAwesome: No one has hidden agendas. I feel that everyone’s loyalty is with THIS team.
question11.exampleOfCrappy:: The team feels like a diverse group of people with different goals, and loyalties that lies elsewhere.

question12.exampleOfAwesome: We give positive appraisals, but also provide constructive feedback on each others unproductive behaviors.
question12.exampleOfCrappy:: We rarely praise each other, or give feedback to each other for acting irresponsibly or breaking our Working Agreement.

question13.exampleOfAwesome: We passionately strive to figure out how to work better and more efficiently as a team. We try to “know” if we get better.
question13.exampleOfCrappy:: We don’t focus on questioning our process or way of working. If someone asked us to prove that we’ve gotten better we have no clue how we would demonstrate that.
